definition.name: NXrcs
definition.doc:
A base class for the Real Time Control System (RCS).
A real time control system (RCS) is a reference architecture model used to design highly task intensive software systems and computing control systems.

field.name: name
field.doc: The name of the real-time control system.

field.name: description
field.doc: The description of the real-time control system.

field.name: type
field.doc: The type of the real-time control system.

field.name: frequency
field.doc: The frequency of the real-time controller system which indicated the number of close-loop process (gathering data, process data and update system) control cycles per unit time.

field.name: measurement_time
field.doc: The time of data measuring in a data lifecycle or process cycle.

field.name: acquisition_time
field.doc: Data acquisition time in single data lifecycle or process cycle of the real-time control system.

field.name: animation_time
field.doc: The time of data animation of single in a data lifecycle or process cycle.

field.name: indication_time
field.doc: The time of data indication of the end of process.
